text: The Giolitti II Cabinet held office from 3 November 1903 until 12 March 1905, a total of 499 days, or 1 year, 4 months and 13 days.II Governo Giolitti ==Government parties== The government was composed by the following parties: {| class=wikitable style="font-size:100%" |- !colspan=2|Party !Ideology !Leader |- | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | Liberalism | Giovanni Giolitti |- | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | Conservatism | Tommaso Tittoni |} The cabinet was externally supported by the Italian Socialist Party. ==Composition== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 100%;" |- ! Office ! Name ! colspan=2|Party ! Term |- ! Prime Minister | Giovanni Giolitti | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- | colspan=6| |- ! Minister of the Interior | Giovanni Giolitti | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of Foreign Affairs | Tommaso Tittoni | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of Grace and Justice | Scipione Ronchetti | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- ! rowspan=3|Minister of Finance | Pietro Romano | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1903) |- | Luigi Luzzatti | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | (1903–1904) |- | Angelo Majorana | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1904–1905) |- ! Minister of Treasury | Luigi Luzzatti | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of War | Ettore Pedotti | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of the Navy | Carlo Mirabello | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of Agriculture, Industry and Commerce | Luigi Rava | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of Public Works | Francesco Tedesco | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- ! Minister of Public Education | Vittorio Emanuele Orlando | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1905) |- ! rowspan=2|Minister of Post and Telegraphs | Enrico Stelluti Scala | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1903–1904) |- | Francesco Tedesco | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1904–1905) |} ==References== Category:Italian governments Category:1903 establishments in Italy
title: Giolitti II Cabinet
